text: President Trump won a partial victory in
his effort to impose a temporary travel
ban at the Supreme Court today it's a
win for two reasons
first of all he lost in the lower courts
and now he has a chance to win before
the Supreme Court which will hear
arguments in October in the meantime the
court agreed to revive part of the
travel ban not all of it but a
significant part the court said that the
ban could come into effect as two people
with no connection to the United States
as the people who've never been here
don't have family members here don't
have a reason to come here for business
or education as to those people
President Trump can ban them if they're
coming from six mostly Muslim nations or
as part of the refugee program but
significantly the court did went the
other way on people who have some what
it called bona fide connection to the
United States so this is a partial win
for the Trump administration so the
court is saying that for the time being
until it hears arguments in October and
decides sometimes later parts of the
travel ban can go into place Justice
Neil Gore said she joined the court in
April has in this case and many others
aligned himself with the most
conservative members of the court three
justices the most conservative members
of the court justices Clarence Thomas
Samuel Alito and Justice Gorsuch
dissented in part from the courts
unsigned order today they said they
would reinstate the entire travel ban
and they certainly indicated that they
were going to vote in favor of the Trump
administration when the case comes back
to the court in the fall so on one level
this is a partial victory for president
Trump on another level the very fact
that this case is in play that he's lost
in the lower courts that he's only had
part of his travel ban revived does
indicate some level of skepticism from
the courts one bottom line is the saga
goes on you might have thought that by
now we'd have some kind of definitive
resolution what we're gonna have instead
is probably more bumps along the road as
courts try to make sense of the
distinction the Supreme Court drew and
then not until the fall which is a
little slow for what the administration
has said as a national security
emergency will we even have arguments
and a decision to come sometime after
that
[Music]
Oh
Oh
